intro: Sarcophrynium bisubulatum, commonly known as the two-whorled sarcophrynium, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on tropical plant morphology and ecology.
